title: [BUG] Sagemaker deployment error in _install_pyfunc_deps
body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

- Client: 2.0.1


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **Python version**: 3.10.4
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

I am trying to deploy a registered pyfunc model to Sagemaker using mlflow version 2.0.1.  Deployment fails when trying to create the environment.  I've had no problems in the past using mlflow version 1.29.0.  I'm logging my model with it's conda environment defined in the same way as before (see below).  I might just be missing something in the new version but I haven't been able to determine what that is so I'm creating this issue.

`    model_env = {
            "name": "my-env",
            "channels": ["conda-forge"],
            "dependencies": [
                "python=3.10.4",
                "pip<=21.2.4",
                {
                    "pip": [
                        "mlflow==2.0.1", 
                        "hyperopt==0.2.5",
                        "joblib==1.1.0",
                        "catboost==1.1.1",
                        "matplotlib==3.5.2",
                        "numpy==1.22.4",
                        "pandas==1.4.1",
                        "scikit_learn==1.1.1",
                        "seaborn==0.11.2",
                        "boto3==1.24.0"
                    ],
                },
            ],
        }

    mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(
        python_model=MyModelWrapper(
            model=best_model,
        ),
        code_path=["./my_model_wrapper.py"],
        artifact_path="model",
        registered_model_name="My_Awesome_Model",
        conda_env=model_env
    )
`

### Tracking information

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```shell
REPLACE_ME
```


### Code to reproduce issue

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
import mlflow
from mlflow.deployments import get_deploy_client

config=dict(
    execution_role_arn=SAGEMAKER_EXECUTION_ROLE_ARN,
    bucket_name=AWS_S3_BUCKET,
    image_url=image_url,
    region_name=AWS_REGION,
    archive=False,
    instance_type="ml.m5.large",
    instance_count=1,
    synchronous=True,
    timeout_seconds=300,
)

deploy_client = get_deploy_client("sagemaker")

deploy_client.create_deployment(
            name=endpoint_name,
            model_uri=model_uri,
            flavor="python_function",
            config=config)

```


### Stack trace

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 57, in _init
    _serve(env_manager)
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 84, in _serve
    _serve_pyfunc(m, env_manager)
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 156, in _serve_pyfunc
    _install_pyfunc_deps(
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 109, in _install_pyfunc_deps
    env_path_dst = os.path.join("/opt/mlflow/", env)
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/posixpath.py", line 90, in join
    genericpath._check_arg_types('join', a, *p)
  File "/miniconda/lib/python3.9/genericpath.py", line 152, in _check_arg_types
    raise TypeError(f'{funcname}() argument must be str, bytes, or '
TypeError: join() argument must be str, bytes, or os.PathLike object, not 'dict````


### Other info / logs

<!-- PLEASE KEEP BACKTICKS AND CHECK PREVIEW -->
```
REPLACE_ME
```
